newsitem.title: USA: DMG hires three senior mortgage-backed specialists.
newsitem.headline: DMG hires three senior mortgage-backed specialists.

text.p: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell said it named three senior mortage-backed securities specialists to expand its commercial mortgage and real estate capital markets operations.
All three had worked for Goldman Sachs, DMG said.
Mike Offit, formerly a senior commercial mortgage-backed securities (CMBS) trader at Goldman Sachs, will join DMG in New York as director of commercial and real estate-based transactions.
Steve Stuart, formerly a vice president in Goldman's real estate department, will also join DMG in New York as director in the real estate capital markets division.
Roger Wittlin joins DMG from Goldman's principal investment group as director in DMG's San Francisco office, where he will help to establish a fixed income sales office, DMG said.
